intro: Fissistigma paniculatum, commonly known as the yellow paniculata, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of yellowish-green inflorescences. Its leaves are typically long and pinnately compound, providing a lush appearance. While not widely cultivated for ornamental purposes, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
